item.description:
Ahoy there, fellow diners! 'Tis yer First Mate Mike lettin' ye know that there be time fer one more trip to the galley before this month be done!

Aye, ye guessed right! We'll be heavin' to at The Ocean Club in Hull at 6:30 on Wednesday, July 29th. With alittle luck, we're hopin' to steal a spot up on deck an' tuck into their hearty pub fare within' sight o' the waves crashin' onto Nantasket Beach far below!

Yarr, 'tis a thought t' warm th' cockles of a foodie's heart!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Ocean Club
42A State Park Rd., Hull
781-925-3030
http://www.oceanclubd...

Organizer: Mike

Maximum number in the galley: None at this time.

Guests: Aye. Up to two per member.

Price Range: Their "Seaworthy Sandwiches" are mostly between $7.99 and $9.99 an' come with fries or chips. Heartier fare will cost ye somewhere between $14.99 (Sirloin Tips) an' $24.99 (Seafood Platter).

Cash Only Policy: Please bring yer pieces of eight! Payin' fer all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy fer over two years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

Event Fee: No Event Fee for current Annual Members. Other Members and Guests: $2.00

RSVP Deadline: Tuesday, July 28th @7:00 PM.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions (Credit to Ocean Club Website)

From Route 3: Take Exit 14 (Route 228) and head North on Route 228 towards Nantasket and Hull. When you reach the intersection of Routes 228 and 53, go straight across Route 53, remaining on Route 228 North, (passing the Scarlet Oak Tavern on your left), following Route 228 through Hingham and going straight across Route 3A when you come to it (this is also the way to Glastonbury Abbey).

Continue on route 228 into Hull, passing The Ocean Club's sister restaurant DiNero's on your right. When you see the ocean, The Ocean Club is the first building on the beach.

From Route 3A: Route 228 intersects with Route 3A in Hingham: From Route 3A, turn North onto Route 228, following the signs for Glastonbury Abbey. You will shortly pass Glastonbury Abbey on your left.

Continue following Route 228 into Hull, passing The Ocean Club's sister restaurant DiNero's on your right. When you see the ocean, The Ocean Club is the first building on the beach.
item.how_to_find_us: Our reservation be under both 'Mike' and 'South Shore Meetup Group'.

group.name: The South Shore Dining Out Meetup Group

item.name: Wash Ashore at The Ocean Club!
